Developed account specific strategies to align with Intel strategies, plans, and priorities.

priorities.

 Senior Marketing Manager Intel Corporation January 2010  –  October 2013  (3 years 10 months) • Responsible for developing business Ultrabook GTM plans including marketing, positioning, securing OEM design wins, and ramping product. 
• Created iPad competitive response guide and companion device positioning along with training for worldwide field sales organization. 
• Provided customer marketing support for HP, Acer, Asus and acted as the conduit for field requests to the factory and provided training to field on product updates. Developed strategic relationships with account teams to drive design wins on business solutions. Regularly developed content for senior executive business update meetings. 
• Worked on annual sales acceleration programs for field to promote PC client refresh and sell up by providing updated proof points, identify pending customer PC purchases and working with field to close deals, and track volumes. 
• Produced business related content and support for various keynotes aimed at both internal and external audiences. Marketing Manager Intel Corporation July 2006  –  December 2009  (3 years 6 months) • Cross segment marketing manager responsible for consumer and business programs. 
• Develop pre-launch and go-to-market plans for new products. 
• Worked with product marketing to develop feature benefit analysis and tracked progress of various initiatives targeted for launch. 
• Responsible for cross division activities to ensure alignment on disclosure timelines, messaging, PR/AR, branding, and launch. 
• Managed cross division and worldwide activities for Core2 Duo processor launch in July 2006. 
• Key stakeholder with corporate brand management to develop new brand and logo along with usage requirements. Co-Marketing Manager Intel Corporation November 2005  –  June 2006  (8 months) • Defined 2006 WiMAX marketing strategy and developed internal and external marketing plan to drive awareness.  
• Developed WiMAX co-marketing plans with partners including Alcatel, Motorola, and Nortel. 
• Drove strategic customer meetings to review roadmaps and identify areas of joint opportunities for demand generation programs. 
• Created joint legally approved WiMAX carrier presentations with accounts for dissemination to sales teams to scale messages. Marketing Manager Intel Corporation April 2003  –  November 2005  (2 years 8 months) • Implemented and drove strategy to increase notebook and WLAN adoption in large businesses by addressing key barriers and highlighting Centrino feature benefits. 
• Developed Centrino messaging targeted for enterprise segment which was used in corporate marketing campaigns at launch. 
• Produced content and supported divisional VP keynotes at various external events. 
• Led worldwide IT customer meetings working with geos, field management, Intel IT, and divisional stakeholders to ensure the voice of the customer was represented in our programs. Results were shared across product and sales divisions and led to direct actions for strategic corporate planning. 
• Developed customer-ready Centrino presentation targeted for field sales to use at Fortune 500 accounts and was a top 10 downloaded document of the year. 
• Created approved joint messaging with leading ISV’s such as SAP, Oracle, Reuters, Adobe, Groove Networks, and Computer Associates highlighting their mobile optimized applications. Program Manager Intel Corporation January 2002  –  March 2003  (1 year 3 months) • Drove APAC Infrastructure Enabling Program for broader WLAN hotspot deployment with leading Telco’s such as PCCW, China Mobile, China Netcom, Korea Telecom, and Hanaro Telecom to prepare for Centrino launch. 
• Developed worldwide Service Provider/OEM co-marketing programs with corporate sales and secured $6M incremental funding to execute program. 
• Conducted 802.11b wireless industry market analysis through analyst reports and forecasts and conducted SWOT analysis of fellow travelers. Project Manager Intel Corporation January 2001  –  January 2002  (1 year 1 month) • Member of Bluetooth SIG Marketing Team and WECA (Wireless Ethernet) Marketing committee representing Intel. 
• Assisted with development, ratification and execution of annual marketing plans and budgets. 
• Chaired cross-company Bluetooth Marketing team responsible for events, contract negotiations, brand management, and speaker recruitment/placement. 
• Project lead for Bluetooth Developers Conference which drew over 2000 attendees worldwide at Moscone Center and secured keynote for Intel as well as content for keynote. Responsibilities included working with vendor on details of conference, tracks, promotional materials, and various marketing outreach activities. Operations Manager Intel Corporation July 1999  –  December 2000  (1 year 6 months) • Managed product recall operations and responsible for implementing and ensuring processes for customer calls, fulfillment, collateral, service centers, and worldwide training when needed. 
• Lead issue manager for Intel 820 chipset MTH recall program and key participant of high level problem resolution team overseeing key decisions and communications to customers and executive management. 
• Managed ongoing $500M FDIV program (Pentium® processor replacement program) 
• Implemented an 80% cost savings for the FDIV program through contract renegotiation with vendor. Summary Core Strengths: leading cross-functional teams to define, drive, and execute on a vision. My computer science & engineering background coupled with an MBA has led me to develop a deep understanding of the technology industry and its various business models. I passionately attend tech talks and read news to stay up-to-date on the latest topics, ideas, and to also develop new relevant skill sets. 
 
I have tailored my career to drive results. I have experience in: Finance, Business Planning, Strategy, Product Management, and Customer Sales & Marketing. 
 
Ideally looking for a Product Manager role or similar responsibilities. Owning and driving business results. 
 
- Ideation: constantly looking for market needs and business opportunities backed by sound market research, customer research, and data 
- Execution: define, scope, and deliver solutions that map into the greater business strategy 
- Team oriented: credit is defined by results which will be attributed to the whole team working towards a common goal

Specialties: Cross-function project management, business planning, customer marketing messaging, market research, product strategy, product positioning, product & feature pricing, branding, market modeling & analysis, data driven decision making, capacity optimization, roadmap creation, financial planning and analysis, budgeting, competitive analysis, strategic sourcing, SMB IT decision making, TCO calculations, network engineering Experience Sr. Customer Marketing Manager - Client Computing Group Intel Corporation March 2013  – Present (2 years 6 months) San Francisco Bay Area Roles & Responsibility: 
 
Own driving PC Client Group customer mobile PNL for key growth customers Samsung & LG. Partner with field sales to align corporate strategies with sales goals. Drive executive alignment between Intel and customers regarding investment and resources to deliver innovative technologies. Additional responsibilities include owning all customer feedback into product platform decisions and driving engagement with ODMs.  
 
*Project manage key designs at lead OEMs ensuring that they hit time to market (TTM) while utilizing Intel's new feature sets and technology 
*Align senior executives with customer executives on strategic investments  
*Develop growth and innovation opportunities in customer product portfolios 
*Create internal investment profiles for key OEM collaborations 
*Lead product sales tours  
 
 Sr. Product Manager - Mobile Strategy and Business Planning Group Intel Corporation March 2010  –  March 2013  (3 years 1 month) San Francisco Bay Area Roles & Responsibilities:  
 
Led the PC Client Group 5-year product roadmap PNL for a $40B+ annual business. Utilized in-depth knowledge of product portfolio, market trends, capital investment strategy, and financials. Drove product requirements across platform generations to ensure Intel’s product portfolio delivered on goals tied to innovation, competitiveness, and cost. 
 
*Work extensively with Intel Market Research group to identify opportunities in the various consumer profiles/segments and determine gaps in Intel's product portfolio 
*Build intricate market models outlining impact of each decision on the various customer segments and PNLs 
*Identify investment and achievable goals for penetrating new markets (Chrome, Android, etc) 
 
Work daily with crossfunctional teams (PMEs, Customer & Competition teams, Sales & Marketing, Market Research, Mobile Roadmap, Finance, Pricing, etc.) to develop comprehensive business plans for recommendations to senior management. Product Manager - Mobile Strategy and Business Planning Group Intel Corporation July 2009  –  March 2010  (9 months) Roles & Responsibilities: 
 
Drove short-term platform product feature decisions through data driven analysis of the mobile market, customer feedback, and ecosystem enablement. Analyze and evaluate Intel’s mobile PC business opportunities (new features, technologies, cost efficiencies, etc.).  
 
Analyze the opportunity by: 
*Assessing the usage appeal leveraging research data and industry feedback  
*Evaluating Intel's ability to sell a given idea to OEMs and ODMs 
*Evaluating the ability of the industry to deliver the needed technologies 
*Understanding current business issues and challenges  
*Understanding the competitive environment  
*Creating detailed business market models with the previous inputs which ultimately produces an ROI analysis 
 
Responsible for driving the engagement through compelling presentations and influencing management and other stakeholder organizations. 
 
Work daily with crossfunctional teams (PMEs, Customer & Competition teams, Sales & Marketing, Market Research, Mobile Roadmap, Finance, Pricing, etc.) to develop comprehensive business plans for recommendations to senior management. 
 Sr. Financial Analyst - Mobile Platform Group Intel Corporation July 2007  –  April 2009  (1 year 10 months) Roles & Responsibilities: 
 
Partnered with senior operations management to align resources to the strategic priorities of the organization and managed financial reporting processes for $150M in annual spending.  
 
*Drove quarterly financial process delivering resource and project prioritization based on ROI metrics utilizing zero-based budget processes. 
*Influenced management to implement an unorthodox organization structure, which ensured resource and spending accountability for the newly created Atom architecture. 
*Developed financial indicators to gauge the effectiveness of our emerging market vitalization projects by identifying key business trends in the customer base.  
 Strategic Sourcing Intern Halliburton May 2006  –  August 2006  (4 months) Designed a plan to reduce Asia-Pacific F&L costs by 10%. 
 
Performed key supplier analysis determining strengths, weaknesses, and potential leveraging points for contract negotiations with major freight forwarders in the region.  
 
Identified and assessed stakeholders' requirements and constraints for the use of freight forwarders to maintain relationships and achieve buy-in on the final recommendation. Streamlined the inventory shipping process to eliminate redundant handling procedures, saving over $0.5M in labor efficiencies.

Summary Entrepreneurial marketing professional with MBA from M.I.T. Sloan and 10+ years of marketing experience. 
 
Key skills: developing strategy, analyzing target market needs and the competition, defining great products and enhancements, positioning them in the market, managing cross-functional teams, driving go-to-market plans, managing product roadmaps 
 
After getting my MBA, I spent 8+ years progressing through different marketing roles at Intel. I gained valuable experience in a number of different marketing functions, including market research, competitive analysis, business strategy, new product development and management, program management, channel marketing, sales operations, product marketing, product planning, and end user demand generation. 
 
Wanting to try something new and willing to take a risk, I left Intel in 2005 to pursue an opportunity in the fast-growing real estate industry. Leveraging my marketing and analytical skills, I worked as a real estate consultant, developed and managed my own vacation rental property, and spent a year in the property management business before getting back into technology. 
 
In 2009, I joined a 12-person, pre-revenue start-up and was integral to the development of a B2B2C online predictive marketing service to help small businesses reach very targeted consumers. I helped drive tremendous growth at SmartZip Analytics, quickly growing to 50+ employees and $8M+ revenue run rate. 
 
In June 2013, I relocated back to the Boston area and did some consulting while seeking full time employment. In December 2013, I joined the Staples Advantage eCommerce Product Management team. 
 
Specialties: Business strategy development, product marketing, product management, operations, competitive analysis, market research, program management, go-to-market strategy, digital marketing, direct mail marketing, data analysis Summary Entrepreneurial marketing professional with MBA from M.I.T. Summary My name is Lester Dimit and I am looking for a challenging and fulfilling career opportunity in supply/demand management or project management. In my 17 years at Intel, I have had a broad range of roles including supplier management, supply/demand management, and product and customer marketing management. I have been able to save Intel millions of dollars pursuing my passion for process improvement. In my current role in customer marketing, I am the key interface between the Wireless and the PC Client Group OEM Marketing team driving design win’s and setting volume targets for our top 10 OEMs. People find me to be a customer focused, results oriented team player with the ability to identify and leverage areas where business and technology intersect. Specialties:Product Marketing proficiency in customer management, supply chain management, supply/demand management, project management, product line management, roadmaps, Go To Market plans, developing value propositions, pricing strategies,competitive response, and market requirements 
Extensive experience in wireless networking and notebook PC technology, product life cycle, collateral development and training.
